org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry

Class PolygonGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PolygonGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph<PointI>

    public class PolygonGrid
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph<PointI>
    Represents a rectangular grid composed of regular polygons. Represents a mesh of identical squares or regular hexagons. The shape of each element is described by a RegularPolygon which must have either four or six RegularPolygon.sides.

    Each polygonal element within the PolygonGrid corresponds to a coordinate pair within an integer rectangle. That is, coordinates range from zero to a user-defined width and height. The exact mapping of elements to coordinates depends on the underlying RegularPolygon and on the associated PolygonGridShift value.

    PolygonGrid supports generic graph algorithms through its implementation of the Graph interface. The graph nodes are the PointI coordinates of all grid locations. Two nodes are considered connected if they correspond to neighboring grid locations. The distance measure is the number of intervening grid locations.

    Other methods provide topological information on grid locations, conversion to and from Graph world coordinates defined by the size of the supplied RegularPolygon, and the creation of a read-only wrapper.

    Note: PolygonGrid defines its location by Integer indices but unlike geometric primitives, calculations do not check for Integer overflow. We assume that PolygonGrid always has a fairly moderate size so that overflow cannot occur.

    • Field Detail

      • INVALID_LOCATION

        public static final PointI INVALID_LOCATION
        Represents an invalid PolygonGrid location. Holds a PointI whose PointI.x and PointI.y components are both -1. This represents a location outside of any PolygonGrid since column and row indices are always zero-based.

        Various PolygonGrid methods return INVALID_LOCATION to indicate that a valid PolygonGrid location could not be found. Clients are encouraged to use this read-only field for the same purpose.

      • isReadOnly

        public final boolean isReadOnly
        Indicates whether the PolygonGrid is read-only. Attempting to modify a read-only PolygonGrid will throw an IllegalStateException. Use asReadOnly() to create a read-only wrapper around a given PolygonGrid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PolygonGrid

        public PolygonGrid(RegularPolygon element)
        Creates a PolygonGrid with the specified element(). gridShift() is set to an appropriate default value for element. size() is set to a default value of (1,1).
        Parameters:
        element - the RegularPolygon that constitutes an element of the PolygonGrid
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if element is neither a square nor a hexagon
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null

      • PolygonGrid

        public PolygonGrid(RegularPolygon element,
                   PolygonGridShift gridShift)
        Creates a PolygonGrid with the specified element() and gridShift(). size() is set to a default value of (1,1).
        Parameters:
        element - the RegularPolygon that constitutes an element of the PolygonGrid
        gridShift - a PolygonGridShift value indicating the shifting of rows or columns in the PolygonGrid
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if element is neither a square nor a hexagon, or gridShift is incompatible with element
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element or gridShift is null

      • PolygonGrid

        public PolygonGrid(PolygonGrid grid)
        Creates a PolygonGrid that is a copy of the specified instance. The two PolygonGrid instances share no mutable data and can be altered independently.
        Parameters:
        grid - the PolygonGrid whose data to copy to the new instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if grid is null

    • Method Detail

      • centerDistance

        public SizeD centerDistance()
        Gets the world distance between the center points of neighboring element() shapes. SizeD.width holds the horizontal distance between neighboring elements within the same row, and SizeD.height holds the vertical distance between neighboring elements within the same column.
        Returns:
        a SizeD indicating the distance, in world coordinates, between the center points of neighboring element() shapes, given the current gridShift()

      • edgeNeighborOffsets

        public PointI[][] edgeNeighborOffsets()
        Gets all coordinate offsets to reach a neighboring location on a shared edge. Identical to neighborOffsets() except that inner arrays never contain offsets to neighboring locations on shared vertices, even if RegularPolygon.vertexNeighbors is true for the current element(). Use getEdgeNeighborOffsets(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PointI) to determine the correct inner array for a given location.

        Note: For better performance, each PolygonGrid instance directly returns its own copy of this array, rather than making another copy on each edgeNeighborOffsets() call. Do not change the array contents!

        Returns:
        a jagged array containing 1x4, 2x4, or 2x6 PointI instances whose coordinates range from -1 to +1 in both dimensions

      • element

        public final RegularPolygon element()
        Gets the RegularPolygon that constitutes a PolygonGrid element. Always either a square or a hexagon.
        Returns:
        the RegularPolygon that constitutes a PolygonGrid element

      • gridShift

        public final PolygonGridShift gridShift()
        Gets a PolygonGridShift value indicating how rows and columns are shifted. Automatically reset to an appropriate default value by setElement(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.RegularPolygon) if the new element() is incompatible with the current value. The following table shows the default gridShift() values for all possible element() shapes:

        Default Values
        elementgridShift
        Square on EdgePolygonGridShift.NONE
        Square on VertexPolygonGridShift.ROW_RIGHT
        Hexagon on EdgePolygonGridShift.COLUMN_DOWN
        Hexagon on VertexPolygonGridShift.ROW_RIGHT
        Returns:
        a PolygonGridShift value indicating how rows and columns are shifted

      • neighborOffsets

        public PointI[][] neighborOffsets()
        Gets all coordinate offsets to reach a neighboring location. The outer array of contains either a single array if gridShift() is null, or two arrays for any other gridShift() value. In that case, the first inner array contains offsets for left-shifted rows or up-shifted columns, and the second inner array contains offsets for right-shifted rows or down-shifted columns.

        The inner arrays contain the number of index positions indicated by the RegularPolygon.connectivity of the current element().

        The array element at index position [i][j] contains the coordinate offsets to reach the neighboring location on edge j when the current location resides in an odd- or even-numbered row or column, as indicated by i. Counting starts at the topmost edge if RegularPolygon.hasTopIndex is true and with the edge to the right of the topmost vertex otherwise, continuing clockwise.

        If RegularPolygon.vertexNeighbors is true for the current element(), the inner arrays instead contain the offsets to the neighboring locations on all edges and vertices in an alternating sequence. Counting starts with the topmost edge for PolygonOrientation.ON_EDGE orientation and with the topmost vertex otherwise, continuing clockwise.

        Use getNeighborOffsets(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PointI) to determine the correct inner array for a given location. Use getNeighbor(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PointI, int) and getNeighbors(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PointI) to directly find one or more neighbors of a given location.

        Note: For better performance, each PolygonGrid instance directly returns its own copy of this array, rather than making another copy on each neighborOffsets() call. Do not change the array contents!

        Returns:
        a jagged array containing 1x4, 2x4, 2x6, or 2x8 PointI instances whose coordinates range from -2 to +2 in both dimensions

      • size

        public final SizeI size()
        Gets the number of rows and columns in the PolygonGrid. Each dimension is always at equal to or greater than one.
        Returns:
        a SizeI whose SizeI.height indicates the number of rows and whose SizeI.width indicates the number of columns

      • worldBounds

        public RectD worldBounds()
        Gets the world bounds of the PolygonGrid. RectD.min is always (0,0). RectD.max defines a size that exactly covers the PolygonGrid, translated to world coordinates.
        Returns:
        a RectD indicating the bounds of the PolygonGrid in world coordinates, given the current element(), gridShift(), and size()

      • areCompatible

        public static boolean areCompatible(RegularPolygon element,
                                    PolygonGridShift gridShift)
        Determines whether the specified RegularPolygon is compatible with the specified PolygonGridShift for a PolygonGrid.

        Legal Combinations
        elementgridShift
        Square on EdgePolygonGridShift.NONE
        Square on Vertex, Hexagon on Edge PolygonGridShift.COLUMN_UP, PolygonGridShift.COLUMN_DOWN
        Square on Vertex, Hexagon on Vertex PolygonGridShift.ROW_LEFT, PolygonGridShift.ROW_RIGHT
        Parameters:
        element - the RegularPolygon to test
        gridShift - the PolygonGridShift to test
        Returns:
        true if element and gridShift are compatible as the element() and gridShift() values of the same PolygonGrid, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if element is neither a square nor a hexagon
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element or gridShift is null

      • asReadOnly

        public PolygonGrid asReadOnly()
        Creates a read-only view of the PolygonGrid. Returns the current instance if isReadOnly is already true.

        The read-only view is a PolygonGrid whose isReadOnly flag is true and whose data is shared with the original instance. Any changes to the original instance will be reflected by the read-only view, whereas attempting to modify the read-only view throws an IllegalStateException.

        Returns:
        a read-only view of the PolygonGrid

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public <T> T[][] createArray(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of all array elements
        Parameters:

      • getEdgeNeighborOffsets

        public PointI[] getEdgeNeighborOffsets(PointI location)
        Gets the inner array of edgeNeighborOffsets() that matches the specified location. Does not check whether location is actually within the PolygonGrid. See edgeNeighborOffsets() and neighborOffsets() for a description of the storage format used for neighbor coordinate offsets.

        Note: For better performance, each PolygonGrid instance directly returns its own copy of this array, rather than making another copy on each getEdgeNeighborOffsets(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PointI) call. Do not change the array contents!

        Parameters:
        location - the PointI location to examine
        Returns:
        the inner array of edgeNeighborOffsets() that matches location
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location is null

      • getElementBounds

        public RectD getElementBounds(int column,
                              int row)
        Gets the bounding rectangle of the element() at the specified column and row indices. Always returns a region within the current worldBounds() if column and row are within the PolygonGrid, but does not check whether that is the case.
        Parameters:
        column - the zero-based index of a PolygonGrid column
        row - the zero-based index of a PolygonGrid row
        Returns:
        a RectD that circumscribes the element() shape at the specified column and row

      • getElementBounds

        public RectD getElementBounds(RectI region)
        Gets the bounding rectangle of all element() shapes within the specified RectI. Always returns a region within the current worldBounds() if region is fully within the PolygonGrid, but does not check whether that is the case.
        Parameters:
        region - a RectI comprising all locations to examine
        Returns:
        a RectD that circumscribes all element() shapes within region
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if region has a zero RectI.width() or RectI.height()
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if region is null

      • getElementVertices

        public PointD[] getElementVertices(int column,
                                   int row)
        Gets the polygon vertices of the element() at the specified column and row indices. Shifts all RegularPolygon.vertices of the element() by the result of gridToWorld(int, int) for the specified column and row. The grid location is not checked against the bounds of the PolygonGrid.
        Parameters:
        column - the zero-based index of a PolygonGrid column
        row - the zero-based index of a PolygonGrid row
        Returns:
        the RegularPolygon.vertices of the element() shape at the specified column and row

      • getNeighbor

        public PointI getNeighbor(PointI location,
                          int index)
        Gets the location that borders the specified location on the specified edge or vertex. Does not check whether location or the returned coordinates are actually within the PolygonGrid. You must perform your own coordinate validation if desired.

        The specified index is taken Fortran.modulo(double, double) the length of the inner arrays within neighborOffsets(), and may therefore be negative or greater than the maximum index. See neighborOffsets() for a description of the index order.

        Parameters:
        location - the PointI location whose neighbor to return
        index - the zero-based index for the inner arrays within neighborOffsets() indicating an edge or vertex of location
        Returns:
        the PointI coordinates of the location that borders location on the edge or vertex indicated by index
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location is null

      • getNeighborIndex

        public int getNeighborIndex(PointI location,
                            PointI neighbor)
        Gets the edge or vertex on which the specified location borders another neighboring location. Does not check whether location or neighbor are actually within the PolygonGrid. You must perform your own coordinate validation if desired.

        getNeighborIndex is the inverse of getNeighbor(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PointI, int). That is, the following relations hold for all locations p with valid neighbors q and neighbor indices i:

        getNeighbor(p, getNeighborIndex(p, q)).equals(q);
        getNeighborIndex(p, getNeighbor(p, i)) == i;

        See neighborOffsets() for a description of the index order.

        Parameters:
        location - the PointI location whose edge or vertex to return
        neighbor - a PointI location neighboring location
        Returns:
        a zero-based index for the inner arrays of neighborOffsets(), indicating the edge or vertex of location on which it borders neighbor
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if location and neighbor are not neighboring locations in the PolygonGrid
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location or neighbor is null

      • getNeighborOffsets

        public PointI[] getNeighborOffsets(PointI location)
        Gets the inner array of neighborOffsets() that matches the specified location. Does not check whether location is actually within the PolygonGrid. See neighborOffsets() for a description of the storage format used for neighbor coordinate offsets.
        Parameters:
        location - the PointI location to examine
        Returns:
        the inner array of neighborOffsets() that matches location
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location is null

      • getStepDistance

        public int getStepDistance(PointI source,
                           PointI target)
        Determines the distance between two specified locations, in movement steps. Returns zero if source and target are equal, and the minimum number of location transitions required to move from source to target otherwise. Does not check whether the PolygonGrid actually contains source and target.

        All distance calculations are O(1) operations, regardless of the concrete values of source and target. The calculations for hexagon grids were adopted from a Usenet post by Matthew V. Jessick.

        Parameters:
        source - the PointI coordinates of the source location
        target - the PointI coordinates of the target location
        Returns:
        the non-negative distance between source and target, in movement steps
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if source or target is null

      • gridToWorld

        public PointD gridToWorld(int column,
                          int row)
        Converts the specified column and row indices to world coordinates. Always returns coordinates within the current worldBounds() if the specified indices are within the PolygonGrid, but does not check whether that is the case.
        Parameters:
        column - the zero-based index of a PolygonGrid column
        row - the zero-based index of a PolygonGrid row
        Returns:
        the PointD world coordinates of the center of the element() shape at the specified column and row in the PolygonGrid

      • gridToWorld

        public PointD gridToWorld(PointI location)
        Converts the specified PointI location to world coordinates. Always returns coordinates within the current worldBounds() if location is within the PolygonGrid, but does not check whether that is the case.
        Parameters:
        location - the PointI location to convert
        Returns:
        the PointD world coordinates of the center of the element() shape at the specified location in the PolygonGrid
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location is null

        public boolean isValid(int column,
                       int row)
        Determines whether the specified column and row indices are valid.
        Parameters:
        column - the PolygonGrid column index to examine
        row - the PolygonGrid row index to examine
        Returns:

        public boolean isValid(PointI location)
        Determines whether the specified PointI location is valid. Always fails for INVALID_LOCATION.
        Parameters:
        location - the PointI location to examine
        Returns:
        true if location is not null and isValid(int, int) succeeds for its components, else false

      • setElement

        public final void setElement(RegularPolygon element)
        Sets the RegularPolygon that constitutes a PolygonGrid element. Also resets gridShift() to an appropriate default value if the current value is incompatible with element, as determined by areCompatible(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.RegularPolygon, org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PolygonGridShift).
        Parameters:
        element - the RegularPolygon that constitutes a PolygonGrid element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if element is neither a square nor a hexagon
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if isReadOnly is true
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null

      • setGridShift

        public final void setGridShift(PolygonGridShift gridShift)
        Sets a PolygonGridShift value indicating how rows and columns are shifted. See gridShift() for default values depending on element().
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if gridShift is incompatible with element()
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if isReadOnly is true
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if gridShift is null

        Throws:

        java.lang.NullPointerException - if size is null

      • worldToGrid

        public PointI worldToGrid(double x,
                          double y)
        Converts the specified world coordinates to a PointI location. Returns coordinates between (0,0) and one less than the current size() in either dimension if the specified world coordinates are within worldBounds(), and the constant value INVALID_LOCATION otherwise.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to convert
        y - the y-coordinate to convert
        Returns:
        the PointI location of the element() whose shape contains (x,y), if any, else INVALID_LOCATION

      • worldToGrid

        public PointI worldToGrid(PointD location)
        Converts the specified PointD world location to a PointI location. Returns coordinates between (0,0) and one less than the current size() in either dimension if the specified location is within worldBounds(), and the constant value INVALID_LOCATION otherwise.
        Parameters:
        location - the PointD world location to convert
        Returns:
        the PointI location of the element() whose shape contains location, if any, else INVALID_LOCATION
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location is null

      • worldToGridClipped

        public PointI worldToGridClipped(double x,
                                 double y)
        Converts the specified world coordinates to a PointI location, clipping to the nearest element() if necessary. Always returns coordinates between (0,0) and one less than the current size() in either dimension, regardless of whether the specified world coordinates are within worldBounds().
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to convert
        y - the y-coordinate to convert
        Returns:
        the PointI location of the element() whose shape contains (x,y), if any, else of the nearest element()

      • worldToGridClipped

        public PointI worldToGridClipped(PointD location)
        Converts the specified PointD world location to a PointI location, clipping to the nearest element() if necessary. Always returns coordinates between (0,0) and one less than the current size() in either dimension, regardless of whether location is within worldBounds().
        Parameters:
        location - the PointD world location to convert
        Returns:
        the PointI location of the element() whose shape contains location, if any, else of the nearest element()
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location is null

      • connectivity

        public int connectivity()
        Gets the maximum number of direct neighbors for any Graph node. Returns the RegularPolygon.connectivity of the current element().
        Specified by:
        connectivity in interface Graph<PointI>
        Returns:
        the maximum number of direct neighbors for any Graph node

      • nodeCount

        public int nodeCount()
        Gets the total number of nodes() in the Graph. Returns the product of SizeI.width and SizeI.height for the current size().
        Specified by:
        nodeCount in interface Graph<PointI>
        Returns:
        the total number of nodes() in the Graph

      • nodes

        public java.util.List<PointI> nodes()
        Gets all nodes in the Graph. Contains all PointI locations defined by size(), starting at (0,0) and incrementing x-coordinates before y-coordinates.
        Specified by:
        nodes in interface Graph<PointI>
        Returns:
        a List of all nodes in the Graph

      • contains

        public boolean contains(PointI node)
        Determines whether the Graph contains the specified node. Returns the result of contains(int, int) for the PointI.x and PointI.y coordinates of node.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Graph<PointI>
        Parameters:
        node - the Graph node to examine
        Returns:
        true if the Graph contains node, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if node is null

      • findNearestNode

        public PointI findNearestNode(PointD location)
        Finds the Graph node nearest to the specified PointD world location. Returns the result of worldToGridClipped(PointD) for location.
        Specified by:
        findNearestNode in interface Graph<PointI>
        Parameters:
        location - the PointD location, in world coordinates, to examine
        Returns:
        the Graph node whose getWorldLocation(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PointI) result is nearest to the specified location
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location is null

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance(PointI source,
                          PointI target)
        Gets the distance between two specified Graph nodes. Returns the result of getStepDistance(org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PointI, org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PointI) for source and target, which is always an Integer value cast to Double.
        Specified by:
        getDistance in interface Graph<PointI>
        Parameters:
        source - the source node in the Graph
        target - the target node in the Graph
        Returns:
        the non-negative distance between source and target
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if source or target is null

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.List<PointI> getNeighbors(PointI node)
        Gets all direct neighbors of the specified Graph node. Returns an empty List if node or all its direct neighbors are not part of the Graph. Otherwise, calculates all direct neighbors by adding each element in the appropriate neighborOffsets() array to node, omitting any neighbors outside the Graph. The resulting list is ordered clockwise.
        Specified by:
        getNeighbors in interface Graph<PointI>
        Parameters:
        node - the Graph node whose direct neighbors to collect
        Returns:
        a List of all Graph nodes that are directly connected with node, numbering from zero to connectivity()
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if node is null

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.List<PointI> getNeighbors(PointI node,
                                           int steps)
        Gets all neighbors of the specified Graph node within the specified step distance. Returns an empty List if node or all its direct neighbors are not part of the Graph. Otherwise, returns a List ordered by increasing x- and then y-coordinates unless steps is one, in which case the result of getNeighbors(PointI) is returned.
        Specified by:
        getNeighbors in interface Graph<PointI>
        Parameters:
        node - the Graph node whose neighbors within steps to collect
        steps - the distance around node, in movement steps, in which other nodes are considered neighbors of node
        Returns:
        a List of all Graph nodes whose step distance from node is greater than zero, but equal to or less than steps
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if steps is equal to or less than zero
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if node is null

      • getWorldLocation

        public PointD getWorldLocation(PointI node)
        Gets the world location of the specified Graph node. Returns the result of gridToWorld(int, int) for the PointI.x and PointI.y coordinates of node.
        Specified by:
        getWorldLocation in interface Graph<PointI>
        Parameters:
        node - the Graph node whose world location to find
        Returns:
        the PointD location of node, in world coordinates
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if node is null

      • getWorldRegion

        public PointD[] getWorldRegion(PointI node)
        Gets the world region covered by the specified Graph node. Returns the result of getElementVertices(int, int) for the PointI.x and PointI.y coordinates of node.
        Specified by:
        getWorldRegion in interface Graph<PointI>
        Parameters:
        node - the Graph node whose world region to find
        Returns:
        an array of PointD vertices defining the polygonal region covered by node, in world coordinates
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if node is null
